column4: shiester_miester: i'm not sure ubuntu would even allow an install without a swap partition, will it??
as long as you don't run out of ram :P say you had a huge amount of ram, a swap partition would be useless
I thought it was a system requirement that the install specifically checks for
curious: why do u have such a funky set up??  for what??
it all just kind of happened by accident :P and it worked at one point so i just left it
well, you're  a braver man than me.  I'm just happy having XP and ubuntu finally set up.  took me 3 complete format/reinstall.
its not my primary computer.  i dont have anything important on it anyway, if it all broke i would just reinstall the OSs
OK.  u must be one bad ass programmer!  I'm still a noob.
i wouldnt say im bad-ass :P im certainly not familiar with most of the languages used in ubuntu
nah certifications are a waste of time, ive already got an I.T degree so i dont see why i would need any more
nice!  expect to see your face on WIRED mag very soon! :)
why do you have to defrag?
hidden files are all across the disk.  moving them avoids conflicts
wha'ts really puzzling is that u DON'T have to defrag linux!
